intro: Sisymbrium orientale f. tenuisiliquum, commonly known as the narrow-seeded babylonian cabbage, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces elongated, narrow pods that contain several small, rounded seeds. It is typically found in disturbed soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia.
